casebody.data:
Briana Washington GLOVER, and Husband, Randie Janson Glover, Individually
v.
The CHARLOTTE-MECKLENBURG HOSPITAL AUTHORITY, a North Carolina Hospital Authority, d/b/a Carolinas Healthcare System, Carolinas Medical Center, Carolinas Healthcare System University, Carolinas Medical Center-University, CMC-University, Carolinas Healthcare System Mercy, Carolinas Medical Center Mercy, CMC-Mercy, Greater Carolinas Women's Center, and Carolinas Laboratory Network; and Glen Ellis Powell, II, MD, Individually No. 356P18 Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 9, 2019 R. Kent Brown, Attorney at Law, Jon Ryan Moore, Attorney at Law, Paige L. Pahlke, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, John R. Taylor, Attorney at Law, Robert E. Zaytoun, Attorney at Law, Matthew D. Ballew, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Glover, Briana Washington, et al. John H. Beyer, Attorney at Law, Katherine H. Graham, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Hospital Authority, et al. Daniel N. Mullins, Attorney at Law, Durham. William Conor Brockett, Associate General Counsel. Phillip T. Jackson, Attorney at Law, Asheville, for N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 19th of October 2018 by Defendants in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 9th of May 2019."

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Defendants on the 1st of November 2018 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 9th of May 2019."

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 1st of November 2018 by Defendants for Temporary Stay:

"Motion Dissolved by order of the Court in conference, this the 9th of May 2019."

Ervin and Davis, J. recused
